Brooklyn Historical Society
Edna Huntington papers and photographs
Huntington, Edna
Kline, Stella O.
ARC.044
3.15 Linear Feet in three manuscript boxes, one phase box, and one oversize folder
1905-1965 The Edna Huntington papers and photographs, dated 1905 to 1965, are organized into three series: Brooklyn Research, Personal Papers, and Photographs. While Brooklyn Research gives a focused view of Huntington's work as a librarian, Personal Papers provides a broader perspective on her career and its impact, as well as her education, her hobbies, and travels during her career. Photographs complements travel journals in the Personal Papers series with black-and-white prints and negatives of Huntington's vacations with her travel companion, Stella Kline. ARC.044 Box 4 of 4 ARC.044 Box 2 of 4 ARC.044 Box 3 of 4 ARC.044 Box 1 of 4 OS-20
Biographical note
Edna Huntington (1895-1965) attended PS 131 in Brooklyn and later completed Columbia University's Home Study courses in Librarianship. She began working for the Long Island Historical Society (now Brooklyn Historical Society) in 1926 and served as Head Librarian from 1936 to 1960. In addition to her work as a librarian, Huntington was an avid traveler. During the 1920s and 1930s, she planned a number of hiking and camping trips throughout the northeast United States and documented her excursions with photographs and detailed travel journals.
Conditions Governing Access
Open to researchers without restriction.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Gift of Edna Huntington, 1960.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date (if known); Edna Huntington papers and photographs, ARC.044, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.
Conditions Governing Use
Reproduction rights for photographs have not been evaluated. Please consult library staff for more information.
Processing Information
Minimally processed to the series level.
This collection is composed of three accessions: 1977.225, 1977.252, and V1997.012.
Oversize folder containing Manual Training High School diploma and other documents was added to the collection by John Zarrillo, March 2017.
Scope and Contents
The Edna Huntington papers and photographs, dated 1905 to 1965, are organized into three series: Brooklyn Research, Personal Papers, and Photographs. While Brooklyn Research gives a focused view of Huntington's work as a librarian, Personal Papers provides a broader perspective on her career and its impact, as well as her education, her hobbies, and travels during her career. Photographs complements travel journals in the Personal Papers series with black-and-white prints and negatives of Huntington's vacations with her travel companion, Stella Kline.
She photographed streets, buildings, and people in the Brooklyn neighborhoods of Downtown Brooklyn, Brooklyn Heights, DUMBO, Fort Greene, Boerum Hill, Carroll Gardens Cobble Hill, Brownsville, Midwood, Bay Ridge, Gowanus, Flatbush, Fort Hamilton, Windsor Terrace, Brighton Beach, Prospect Park, Prospect Heights, Sheepshead Bay, Gravesend, Bensonhurst, Flatlands, East Flatbush, Borough Park, Coney Island, Bath Beach, Dyker Heights, Cypress Hills, New Lots, Canarsie, New Lots, Bedford Stuyvesant, Mill Basin, Marine Park, Ridgewood, Park Slope, East New York, Clinton Hill, Williamsburg, Bushwick, and Manhattan Beach.
Related Materials
The Edna Huntington Photograph Collection (V1974.016) contains over 3,000 documentary photographs of Brooklyn taken by Huntington during the mid-1940s.
Photograph Records
Item-level description and digital versions of images from the collection are available for searching via the online image database

Series 1: Brooklyn Research0.5 Linear Feetin two manuscript boxes.1926-1960
Scope and Contents
This series consists of research notes made by Huntington on various topics related to Brooklyn and Long Island history, including authors, mills, cemeteries, historic markers, and monuments. Also included is a copy of "Historical Markers and Monuments in Brooklyn" with marginal notes by Huntington.Series 2: Personal Papers1.95 Linear Feetin two manuscript boxes and one oversize folder1887-1965
Scope and Contents
Personal Papers includes Huntington's early school records and Manual Training High School diploma; correspondence relating to her library education at Columbia University and obtaining her position as librarian at the Long Island Historical Society (LIHS); travel journals, 1920-1940; certificates; newspaper clippings; a scrapbook compiled by LIHS staff as a retirement gift; genealogical papers; bookplates; and the printing block for her personal bookplate.Series 3: PhotographsV1997.0120.9 Linear Feetin one manuscript box and one phase box.1917-1941
Scope and Contents
Photographs contains negatives, black-and-white prints, and scrapbooks (titled "Travelogues") of Huntington's travels and outdoor activities, including hiking, camping, and canoeing. This series documents her almost yearly vacations from 1917 to 1941. Images show natural landscapes, camp grounds, and informal shots of Huntington and her travel companion, Stella Kline. Four scrapbooks written by Huntington and Kline combine dozens of photographs with a detailed narrative of each trip. Their destinations included the New England states, Nova Scotia and New Brunswick, Canada, the Smoky Mountain region, and Bermuda.
